channel.title: Data Engineering on Yanir Seroussi – AI/ML Engineering Consultant
channel.description: Recent content in Data Engineering on Yanir Seroussi – AI/ML Engineering Consultant
channel.copyright: Text and figures licensed under CC BY-NC-ND 4.0 by Yanir Seroussi, except where noted otherwise

item.title: Giving up on the minimum viable data stack
item.description: Exploring why universal advice on startup data stacks is challenging, and the importance of context-specific decisions in data infrastructure.

item.title: Your first Data-to-AI hire: Run a lovable process
item.description: Video and key points from the second part of a webinar on a startup’s first data hire, covering tips for defining the role and running the process.

item.title: Learn about Dataland to avoid expensive hiring mistakes
item.description: Video and key points from the first part of a webinar on a startup’s first data hire, covering data & AI definitions and high-level recommendations.

item.title: Plumbing, Decisions, and Automation: De-hyping Data & AI
item.description: Three essential questions to understand where an organisation stands when it comes to Data & AI (with zero hype).

item.title: My experience as a Data Tech Lead with Work on Climate
item.description: The story of how I joined Work on Climate as a volunteer and became its data tech lead, with lessons applied to consulting & fractional work.

item.title: The data engineering lifecycle is not going anywhere
item.description: My key takeaways from reading Fundamentals of Data Engineering by Joe Reis and Matt Housley.

item.title: Building your startup's minimum viable data stack
item.description: First post in a series on building a minimum viable data stack for startups, introducing key definitions, components, and considerations.

item.title: Substance over titles: Your first data hire may be a data scientist
item.description: Advice for hiring a startup’s first data person: match skills to business needs, consider contractors, and get help from data people.

item.title: Supporting volunteer monitoring of marine biodiversity with modern web and data tools
item.description: Summarising the work Uri Seroussi and I did to improve Reef Life Survey’s Reef Species of the World app.

item.title: You don't need a proprietary API for static maps
item.description: For many use cases, libraries like cartopy are better than the likes of Mapbox and Google Maps.

item.title: Lessons from reluctant data engineering
item.description: Video and summary of a talk I gave at DataEngBytes Brisbane on what I learned from doing data engineering as part of every data science role I had.
